intro: Hieracium brevifolium subsp. brachyphyllum, commonly known as the short-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are narrow and short, giving it its common name. This subspecies is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain grassland ecosystems.
